text: ਅਨਦਿਨੁ ਸਦਾ ਰਹੈ ਰੰਗਿ ਰਾਤਾ ਕਰਿ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਾਇਦਾ ॥੬॥

translation.text: One who remains forever imbued with His Love, night and day - in His Mercy, the Lord inspires him to perform devotional worship service. ||6||

transliteration.text: anadin sadā rahai rang rātā kar kirapā bhagat karāidā .6.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਇਸੁ ਮਨ ਮੰਦਰ ਮਹਿ ਮਨੂਆ ਧਾਵੈ ॥

translation.text: In this temple of the mind, the mind wanders around.

transliteration.text: is man mandar mah manūā dhāvai .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਸੁਖੁ ਪਲਰਿ ਤਿਆਗਿ ਮਹਾ ਦੁਖੁ ਪਾਵੈ ॥

translation.text: Discarding joy like straw, it suffers in terrible pain.

transliteration.text: sukh palar tiāg mahā dukh pāvai .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Without meeting the True Guru, it finds no place of rest; He Himself has staged this play. ||7||

transliteration.text: bin satigur bhētē thaur n pāvai āpē khēl karāidā .7.

translation.text: What can the poor creatures do? Granting forgiveness, He unites them with Himself. ||8||

translation.text: Uniting them with Himself, He bestows glorious greatness; He inspires them to focus their consciousness on the True Lord. ||9||

translation.text: They never think about the Messenger of Death; in the end, they leave, regretting and repenting. ||15||

transliteration.text: jamakālai kī khabar n pāī ant gaiā pashutāidā .15.

translation.text: Slave Nanak offers ths prayer; O Lord, let my consciousness be attached to the True Name. ||16||2||16||

transliteration.text: nānak dās kahai bēnantī sach nām chit lāidā .16.2.16.

translation.text: Maaroo, Third Mehl:

translation.text: From the very beginning of time, and throughout the ages, the Merciful Lord has been the Great Giver.

text: ਤੁਧੁਨੋ ਸੇਵਹਿ ਸੇ ਤੁਝਹਿ ਸਮਾਵਹਿ ਤੂ ਆਪੇ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲਾਇਦਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: Those who serve You are immersed in You. You unite them in Union with Yourself. ||1||

transliteration.text: tudhunō sēvah sē tujhah samāvah tū āpē mēl milāidā .1.

text: ਜਿਉ ਤੁਧੁ ਭਾਵੈ ਤਿਵੈ ਚਲਾਵਹਿ ਤੂ ਆਪੇ ਮਾਰਗਿ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੨॥

translation.text: As is pleases Your Will, You guide us along; You Yourself place us on the Path. ||2||

text: ਆਪਣਾ ਆਪੁ ਪਛਾਣਹਿ ਆਪੇ ਗੁਰਮਤੀ ਆਪਿ ਬੁਝਾਇਦਾ ॥੪॥

text: ਪਾਤਾਲ ਪੁਰੀਆ ਲੋਅ ਆਕਾਰਾ ॥ ਤਿਸੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਰਤੈ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਕਰਾਰਾ ॥

translation.text: Your Almighty Command prevails throughout the nether worlds, realms and worlds of form.
